smoke-tests of Hive passed too.

```
$ ./docker-hadoop.sh \
       --create 3 \
       --image bigtop/puppet:trunk-centos-7 \
       --memory 8g \
       --repo file:///bigtop-home/output \
       --disable-gpg-check \
       --stack hdfs,yarn,mapreduce,hbase,hive,spark \
       --smoke-tests hdfs,yarn,mapreduce,hbase,hive,spark
...
BUILD SUCCESSFUL in 17m 34s
49 actionable tasks: 26 executed, 23 up-to-date
```

The fix worked for me on manual testing. I guess commons-lang disappeared from transitive dependencies.

```
[root@cf5370850071 /]# sqoop import --connect jdbc:mysql://localhost/test --table test
...
2022-07-13 16:45:29,826 INFO mapreduce.ImportJobBase: Transferred 12 bytes in 21.0065 seconds (0.5713 bytes/sec)
2022-07-13 16:45:29,829 INFO mapreduce.ImportJobBase: Retrieved 2 records.
```

> @kevinw66 Could you increment the release number to 2 in bigtop.bom? The package name will be updated to `sqoop-1.4.7-2.el7.noarch.rpm`.
> 
> ```
>     'sqoop' {
>       name    = 'sqoop'
>       relNotes = 'Apache Sqoop v1'
>       version { base = '1.4.7'; pkg = base; release = 1 }
> ```

Updated, thanks @iwasakims
I merged this to branch-3.1 and **master**. While we can not test it until [BIGTOP-3737](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-3737) is resolved, I'm assuming master is affected too.

Thanks for working on it. @timyuer 
I verified it by docker test scripts by @kevinw66 .
That's pretty convenient and it works.


On the other hand, I think this Sqoop services was ported from `common-services` of Ambari-2.7.5.
`https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/release-2.7.5/ambari-server/src/main/resources/common-services/SQOOP/1.4.4.2.0/package/scripts/service_check.py`

Would you please also port the `service_check.py` in this Mpack.

`service_check.py` defined some smoke tests and would be triggered during deployment by Ambari.
It helps users to confirm whether sqoop works or not.
IMHO, the above test cases from @kevinw66  could be included in `service_check.py`.
Thanks.

> Thanks for working on it. @timyuer I verified it by docker test scripts by @kevinw66 . That's pretty convenient and it works.
> 
> On the other hand, I think this Sqoop services was ported from `common-services` of Ambari-2.7.5. `https://github.com/apache/ambari/blob/release-2.7.5/ambari-server/src/main/resources/common-services/SQOOP/1.4.4.2.0/package/scripts/service_check.py`
> 
> Would you please also port the `service_check.py` in this Mpack.
> 
> `service_check.py` defined some smoke tests and would be triggered during deployment by Ambari. It helps users to confirm whether sqoop works or not. IMHO, the above test cases from @kevinw66 could be included in `service_check.py`. Thanks.

@guyuqi The `service_check.py` is ported from common-services, the test cases I used above, need external datasource connection, which may greatly increased the complexity.

The sqoop service would be successfully deployed and checked.
![sqoop](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20575685/178973569-63e1c70e-beb5-46be-9a0c-b6629816416f.png)

+1
Thanks for your contribution.  @timyuer @kevinw66
merged to branch-3.1 and master. Thanks, @kevinw66.

Are you using the Hadoop packaged by Bigtop 3.1.0? WebHDFS does not work due to ~[BIGTOP-3714](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-3714)~ if so.
![20220718161924](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16263438/179471545-ed917ffe-d2f3-4933-b628-af6ade40db9e.png)

Please use the following snapshot repository to run smoke test:
https://sekikn-repo.s3.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/centos-7/
![å¾®ä¿¡å›¾ç‰‡_20220718155147](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16263438/179467308-afc9a891-2aae-4a58-a948-f79130ce47b6.jpg)

Thanks, I didn't define `role_command_order.json`

![check_tez](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16263438/179483403-bcf95d12-21f4-41b0-af25-c46893d668f7.png)

It works after `role_command_order.json` defined. 
Successfully checked Tez service. 
+1, LGTM

Merged. 
thanks, @timyuer
+1 LGTM, thanks @HalimKim

tested on RockyLinux 8 x86_64:

```
./docker-hadoop.sh \
       --create 1 \
       --image bigtop/puppet:trunk-rockylinux-8 \
       --memory 16g \
       --repo file:///bigtop-home/output \
       --disable-gpg-check \
       --stack hdfs,yarn,mapreduce,zeppelin \
       --smoke-tests zeppelin
```

> ./gradlew zeppelin-clean zeppelin-pkg

I think this does not work now in master branch due to [BIGTOP-3751](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-3751)(https://github.com/apache/bigtop/pull/951). Which branch did you use for testing? @HalimKim.
The patch itself is LGTM.

> > ./gradlew zeppelin-clean zeppelin-pkg
> 
> I think this does not work now in master branch due to [BIGTOP-3751](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-3751)(#951). Which branch did you use for testing? @HalimKim.

I used **branch-3.1** thank you for checking pr

https://github.com/apache/bigtop/tree/branch-3.1
Verified this PR based on https://github.com/apache/bigtop/pull/951 on Centos-7

Tested it on centos-7.
+1
Merged, thanks  @HalimKim
cherry-picked to branch-3.1 along with #951.

hi, @iwasakims, please watch this patch, the patch will improve hive on tez feature. thanks.

got no issue on running smoke-tests on Rocky Linux 8 x86_64:

```
$ ./docker-hadoop.sh \
       --create 1 \
       --image bigtop/puppet:trunk-rockylinux-8 \
       --memory 16g \
       --repo file:///bigtop-home/output \
       --disable-gpg-check \
       --stack hdfs,yarn,mapreduce,hive \
       --smoke-tests hive
...
:bigtop-tests:smoke-tests:hive:test (Thread[Execution worker for ':' Thread 7,5,main]) completed. Took 13.293 secs.

BUILD SUCCESSFUL in 43s
34 actionable tasks: 7 executed, 27 up-to-date
```

Test it on my local environment too:

```
./docker-hadoop.sh --create 3 \
    --image bigtop/puppet:trunk-rockylinux-8 \
    --memory 16g --repo file:///bigtop-home/output \ 
    --disable-gpg-check --enable-local-repo \
    --stack hdfs,yarn,mapreduce,hive   \
     --smoke-tests hive
```

```

+1,
LGTM
Merged, thanks @iwasakims

Test the HBase smoke tests successfully on Rockylinux-8.
```
./docker-hadoop.sh --create 3    \
  --image bigtop/puppet:trunk-rockylinux-8    \
  --memory 16g --repo file:///bigtop-home/output    \
 --disable-gpg-check --enable-local-repo    \
 --stack hdfs,yarn,mapreduce,hbase    \
 --smoke-tests hbase
```

```
$ cd docker/bigtop-puppet
$ ./build.sh trunk-ubuntu-22.04
...
Processing triggers for dbus (1.12.20-2ubuntu4) ...

```

```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project hbase-common: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.apache.hbase:hbase-common:jar:2.4.13: Could not find artifact org.apache.hadoop:hadoop-common:jar:3.3.4 in central (https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2) -> [Help 1]
```

You need to build Hadoop first (by `./gradlew hadoop-pkg`) to install artifacts of Hadoop 3.3.4 to local repository. It is not found in public Maven repositories since it is not released yet.

> On the other hand I successfully tested smoke tests of Hadoop-3.3.4 and Hbase 2.4.13 without patch1-relocate-okhttp.diff.

The patch is for **building** HBase against Hadoop 3.3.4. I guess you used HBase 2.4.13 already built against Hadoop 3.3.3 here.

> ```
> [ERROR] Failed to execute goal on project hbase-common: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.apache.hbase:hbase-common:jar:2.4.13: Could not find artifact org.apache.hadoop:hadoop-common:jar:3.3.4 in central (https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2) -> [Help 1]
> ```
> 
> You need to build Hadoop first (by `./gradlew hadoop-pkg`) to install artifacts of Hadoop 3.3.4 to local repository. It is not found in public Maven repositories since it is not released yet.

ok,  let me try to build Hadoop-3.3.4 and Hbase-2.4.13 in the single docker container.
`docker run --rm -v `pwd`:/ws --workdir /ws bigtop/slaves:trunk-rockylinux-8 bash -c '. /etc/profile.d/bigtop.sh; ./gradlew hadoop-clean hbase-clean hadoop-pkg hbase-pkg'`

@iwasakims 
I tried this on Ubuntu 20.04 / x86 host machine, but it succeeded.
I found that on Ubuntu 21.04 similar problems occurred: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cloud-images/+bug/1943049
In the discussion, host machine's docker engine have to be updated to support clone3 syscall. The root cause seems to be the same with the problem reported in https://github.com/apache/bigtop/pull/961#issuecomment-1193485005.

Would you tell me the docker engine version ? (My Ubuntu 20.04 machine uses docker enging `20.10.14`)

[WARNING] /usr/bin/ld: CMakeFiles/oom-listener.dir/main/native/oom-listener/impl/oom_listener_main.c.o: relocation R_X86_32 against `.rodata.str1.1' can not be used when making a PIE object; recompile with -fPIE
[WARNING] collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
[WARNING] make[2]: *** [CMakeFiles/oom-listener.dir/build.make:113: target/usr/local/bin/oom-listener] Error 1
[WARNING] make[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/Makefile2:226: CMakeFiles/oom-listener.dir/all] Error 2
[WARNING] make[1]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
....
..
.
```

Arm64:
```
[WARNING] /usr/bin/ld: CMakeFiles/oom-listener.dir/main/native/oom-listener/impl/oom_listener_main.c.o: relocation R_AARC_ADR_PREL_PG_HI21 against symbol `stderr@@GLIBC_2.17' which may bind externally can not be used when making a shared obje recompile with -fPIC
[WARNING] /usr/bin/ld: CMakeFiles/oom-listener.dir/main/native/oom-listener/impl/oom_listener_main.c.o(.text+0x70): unresable R_AARCH64_ADR_PREL_PG_HI21 relocation against symbol `stderr@@GLIBC_2.17'
[WARNING] /usr/bin/ld: final link failed: bad value
[WARNING] collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status

```

It seems that `CFLAGS="-fPIC"` should be added when building shared object.

Packaging and smoke-tests of Hadoop, HBase, Hive and Spark passed as expected on RC1.

I think I misunderstood the intent of the conditional. Only CentOS 7 needs `BuildRequires: cmake3` since CMake 2 is provided as **cmake** and CMake 3 is provided as **cmake3**. Newer RHEL family provides CMake 3 as **cmake**. The conditional is working as expected.

CentOS 7:
```
$ rpm -q cmake
cmake-2.8.12.2-2.el7.x86_64

$ rpm -q cmake3
cmake3-3.17.5-1.el7.x86_64
```

Rocky Linux 8:
```
$ rpm -q cmake
cmake-3.20.2-4.el8.x86_64
```
@guyuqi Do you still want to remove the conditional at all? I think it makes sence if we need to install CMake from source code in the future.

Hi @iwasakims ,
In Centos7 (`bigtop/slaves:trunk-centos-7` ` x86_64/arm64`):
`cmake3` was pre-installed and linked to `cmake` by default :
```
[root@a06bcc19ce22 /]# whereis cmake
cmake: /usr/bin/cmake
[root@a06bcc19ce22 /]# ls /usr/bin/cmake -al
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 15 May 13 01:55 /usr/bin/cmake -> /usr/bin/cmake3

[root@a06bcc19ce22 /]# cmake --version
cmake3 version 3.17.5

```

IMHO,  it makes sense to remove cmake conditional here.
Merged, thanks @yzydhf

After further investigation, I found that since fedora 36, some flags are set by default when developers build the code through `rpmbuild`.
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Changes/SetBuildFlagsBuildCheck

I added opt-out option to the SPEC file rather than adding build flag at this time, and checked building Hadoop succeeded on both Fedora 36 and 35.

> /var/log/spark/spark-thriftserver.out

The log destination should be /var/log/spark/spark-thriftserver.log rather than spark-thriftserver.out.
